titleStmt.title: Private Letter: 1881 November 3: to von Haast

front.p: 1881 November 3: to von Haast ATL MS-papers-0037-046.

body.p: I have lately returned unwell from the forests (where I had been 10–12 days, 6 of which were rainy ones!)—and find a note from you, with all my Eng. & other letters, awaiting me.—I write this line to say, that I will endeavor to send you one copy of ea. next week. I have had a great demand for them: indeed I wanted 50–100 copies of ea. from Dr. H. (I paying for them) but could not succeed.
You never acknowledged my note of last autumn re the same. In haste,
P.S. Some of my Papers of this year—in continuation of the same great subject,—are more strange still. These are sent to Dr. Hector.
